title: Regulatory Relief To Promote Domestic Production of Critical Medicines

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs federal agencies to streamline regulations and speed up approvals to encourage more pharmaceutical manufacturing within the United States, improving the domestic supply of critical medicines. It also increases oversight and fees on foreign drug manufacturers to support these efforts and improve transparency about foreign inspections.
potential_concerns: Accelerated permitting and regulatory streamlining may reduce environmental safeguards and increase risks of pollution or habitat damage.
Increased fees on foreign facilities could raise drug costs or lead to reduced international supply cooperation.
The FDA’s promise to reduce inspections and oversight for domestic manufacturers may risk drug safety or quality issues.
Coordinating multiple federal agencies’ permitting and regulatory reviews could face bureaucratic delays or conflicts.
Lack of explicit provisions addressing equitable access or support for smaller pharmaceutical manufacturers may favor large industry players.
